greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) read by rows: coefficients of polynomials P_n(t) defined in Formula section.
comment: T(n,k) is the number of Feynman's diagrams with k fermionic loops in the order n of the perturbative expansion in dimension zero for the vertex function in a many-body theory of fermions with two-body interaction (see Molinari link).
link: Luca G. Molinari, Hedin's equations and enumeration of Feynman's diagrams, arXiv:cond-mat/0401500 [cond-mat.str-el], 2005.
formula: A(x;t) = Sum_{n>=0} P_n(t)*x^n = 1 + x*s + 2*x^2 * deriv(s,x), where s(x;t) = A286781(x;t) and P_n(t) = Sum_{k=0..n-1} T(n,k)*t^k for n>0.
mathematica: row[n_] := (2n+1) CoefficientList[Coefficient[y0[x, t], x, n], t];
Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, max}, {k, 0, If[n == 0, 0, n-1]}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 19 2017, adapted from PARI *)
results.author: _Gheorghe Coserea_, May 14 2017
